page.title: 02An old Ropley family
page.content: My family's connections with Ropley go back to January 1873 when my great, great grandmother,Miss E A Kelly came to the village as Mistress of Ropley School.She only stayed at school for a short time as she then married Mr Hale the village blacksmith and undertaker. My great grandmother, grandmother and mother were all born in Ropley. Life was very different when they were all young. When my mother came to school there were only 3 classes in what is now our hall and kitchen. School meals were delivered by van to the village hall and toilets were wooden huts with buckets which were emptied every day. Very few people had cars but there were four shops and a post office so people didn't need to go out of the village. I like Ropley very much and I would like to spend my life here but that will depend on the work I do.
